bullets.text: UAE-linked investor quietly took a stake in Trump family crypto venture, raising foreign-influence and compliance risks around politically connected digital-asset businesses.
Risk-off tone: U.S. stock futures fell alongside bitcoin and oil, while precious-metals weakness signaled broader deleveraging pressure across asset classes.
Gold and silver extended a historic plunge (gold down ~5%), challenging safe-haven assumptions and potentially tightening collateral conditions for leveraged investors.
Speaker Johnson said he’s confident the U.S. government shutdown will end by Tuesday, reducing near-term policy uncertainty but highlighting recurring fiscal brinkmanship.
Oracle plans to raise up to $50B this year to fund AI expansion, underscoring escalating capital needs for compute, data centers, and AI infrastructure competition.
EV demand pullback is hitting Southern U.S. factories and jobs, signaling a slower electrification ramp and higher transition risk for regional industrial policy bets.
AstraZeneca will list in New York while investing heavily in China, reflecting Big Pharma’s need to balance U.S. capital/market access with China innovation exposure.
India’s budget targets modest fiscal consolidation, aiming to improve debt dynamics without sharply constraining growth—important for EM risk pricing and capital flows.
India offered zero taxes through 2047 to attract global AI workloads, intensifying competition for data centers, chips, and energy, and reshaping AI geography.
Russia struck Ukraine’s energy sector, killing miners; continued infrastructure attacks raise winter resilience costs and keep European energy-security risks elevated.
A secret Egyptian air base is reportedly enabling Sudan’s drone war, signaling regional power projection and escalation risk around Red Sea and Nile security corridors.
Western U.S. snow drought hit record levels, worsening water and hydropower outlooks and raising longer-run agricultural, municipal, and wildfire economic risks.
Notepad++ distribution was hijacked by state-sponsored actors, highlighting supply-chain software risk and the need for stronger signing, verification, and update controls.
Researchers report a hidden bat virus infecting humans, reinforcing surveillance and spillover-preparedness priorities with potential downstream public-health and economic impacts.
